story.kicker_image_caption: The wrong map was covered with white paint after Indian officials pointed out the gaffe. (ANI Photo)
story.storykicker: An erroneous map put up at Mohammad V University in Rabat showed Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh  as parts of India. The gaffe was spotted moments before Vice-President Mohammad Hamid Ansari arrival.
story.storybody:
An 'expanded' map showing Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh as parts of India was put on display at a university in Morocco's capital Rabat where Vice-President Mohammad Hamid Ansari was to deliver a lecture today.

Ansari is on a six-day (30 May to 4 June) tour to African countries Morocco and Tunisia.

THE ERRONEOUS MAP

Vice-President Ansari was scheduled to deliver a lecture at Mohammad V University in Rabat. Moments before his arrival, Indian officials noticed a map on one of the hoardings erected to welcome Ansari.

The map wrongly depicted Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh as parts of India. Indian officials immediately pointed the mistake to the organisers and university staff.

The map was then covered with white tape before Ansari's arrival.

INDIA, MOROCCO SIGN 2 MoUs

Two MoUs on cultural cooperation and institutional training were signed after Ansari met Moroccan Prime Minister Abdelilah Benkirane yesterday (May 31)

Five Memorandum of Understandings (MoUs) had been finalised between India and Morocco for improving bilateral relations but only two could be signed.

"We reviewed all aspects of our expanding cooperation. Morocco is crucial to us for food security as it is the main supplier of phosphate which is crucial for agriculture," Ansari said as the two leaders jointly spoke to the media. 

Rabat: The erroneous maps were covered by college officials minutes before VP Hamid Ansari arrived at the college pic.twitter.com/amSxqI33AH

�?? ANI (@ANI_news) June 1, 2016

Rabat: Indian officials have intervened. The 'expanded' Indian map with Pakistan in it has white tape over it now pic.twitter.com/tV6IJECFGI

�?? ANI (@ANI_news) June 1, 2016

Rabat (Morocco): Indian Map with Pakistan in it, spotted on a hoarding outside university where VP Ansari will speak pic.twitter.com/GObcJvZss2

�?? ANI (@ANI_news) June 1, 2016

story.shortheadline: Indian map includes Pak, Bangladesh in Morocco university goof-up while hosting Hamid Ansari

The erroneous map covered before Hamid Ansari's arrival
Ansari is on a six-day tour to African countries Morocco and Tunisia
